at.htl.geometrics

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.htl.geometrics.Circle

  • public class Circle
extends java.lang.Object
    Represent a circle with a centre-point and a radius.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jakob Ecker, Dominik Simon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle()
      Constructs a new empty Circle-Object.
      Circle(Point m, double r)
      Constructs a new Circle-Object witch centre-point m and radius r.

      • Circle

        public Circle(Point m,
      double r)
        Constructs a new Circle-Object witch centre-point m and radius r.

        m - Centre-point of the Circle.
        r - Radius of the Circle.

      • Circle

        public Circle()
        Constructs a new empty Circle-Object.

    • Method Detail

      • getPointsOfIntersection

        public Point[] getPointsOfIntersection(Circle c)
        Calculates the points of intersection with the circle c. If there are no points of intersection the method will interpolate one representative point as intersection point.
        Parameters:
        c - The second Circle for the intersection calculation.
        Returns:
        Point-Array with the size 2. If there is only one intersection point both array-slots contain this point.

      • getCentre

        public Point getCentre()
        Returns the centre-point of the Circle as Point.
        Returns:
        Centre-Point of the Circle as Point.

        Sets the centre-point if the Circle.

      • getRadius

        Returns:

      • setRadius

        public void setRadius(double r)

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Custom toString that returns a formatted Circle.

        toString in class java.lang.Object
